alert.note: Alert for Far South Miami-Dade County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Mainland Monroe (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 10:13AM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Mainland Monroe County through 1045 AM EDT... At 1013 AM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a funnel cloud over Northwest Cape Sable, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds, wind gusts up to 50 mph, and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Northwest Cape Sable, Middle Cape Sable, Flamingo and Everglades National Park. FUNNEL CLOUD...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Move indoors and stay away from windows.

area.areaDesc: Far South Miami-Dade County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Mainland Monroe
